name: Wicked Nix
description:
A charmingly mischievous world premiere!

Nix is the foulest of the fairies. With the Faerie Queen away, this mischievous sprite is tasked with safeguarding their forest from a most dangerous enemy â€“ humans. When one such foe settles into a cottage in the woods on the eve of the Queen's return, Nix conjures a few wicked tricks to drive him away. His efforts fail, and Nix is faced with difficult choices and an even more dangerous truth. Based on the award-winning book by acclaimed author Lena Coakley (CBC's 2018 Best Book of the Year), this whimsical romp explores the timeless bonds of family and the joy of finding home in unexpected places.

Adapted for the stage by Paula Wing
Based on the novel by Lena Coakley
Directed by Stephen Colella

name: Who We'll Be: Doris McCarthy Gallery Curatorial Mentorship Exhibition at Cedar Ridge
description:
Dive into the complex journey of young adulthood in Who We'll Be, an exhibition curated by Sydney Ly, graduating student in Studio Art at U of T Scarborough, as part of the Doris McCarthy Gallery Curatorial Mentorship Program. 

This powerful showcase features recent works by U of T Studio Art students, capturing the emotional turbulence of this pivotal life stage. The artists confront the pressures of fitting in while carving their own paths, reflecting on the choices that shape their careers, identities, and relationships. Who We'll Be is a compelling exploration of navigating independence, societal expectations, and staying true to oneself. 

Featuring works by Minah Cap, Edward Ma, Cindy Nguyen, Markle Ning, Gina Pang, Sophia Seoh, Jiajing Tang, and Molly Wang.
